page.title: 18HYLANDS HOUSE CHELMSFORD
page.content: Hylands House was built in 1728 for {Sir John Comyns}who was then Member of Parliament for Maldon.It is a large elegant building with 8 cellars and 30 main rooms. The Ionic style portico with four columns was added later.It remained a family home until 1962 when the last private owner died. The House and surrounding 440 acre Park were bought by{Chelmsford Borough Council}4 years later;the Park since being opened to the public. Over the last 20 years there have been many suggestions as to what plans there could be for Hylands House and Park.One suggestion was to turn the House into flats.{The latest idea is {to use the grounds as a golf course {and the House as the clubhouse.} This is causing much local debate at present,as there are mixed feelings about the proposal.
